snippet: A federal district court judge issued a sound decision in denying a bishops’ group a new contract because it imposes religion-based restrictions on the use of taxpayer dollars.
abstract: Editorial defends Obama administration for declining to renew the contract of the United States Conference of Catholic Bishops to aid victims of human trafficking; holds contract was not renewed because of group's refusal to allow subcontractors to use federal money they received to pay for contraceptive and abortion services; urges Congress to reauthorize and strengthen the Trafficking Victims Protection Act, which expired in 2011.
lead_paragraph: A federal district court judge issued a sound decision in denying a bishops’ group a new contract because it imposes religion-based restrictions on the use of taxpayer dollars.

headline.seo: Sex Trafficking and the First Amendment
headline.main: Sex Trafficking and the First Amendment
